Detailed Description

(blackadder Core) The Netlink Element is the base element that creates, opens and binds to the netlink socket of Blackadder.

It does not receive or push packets. It is passed as a paramater to the FromNetlink and ToNetlink Elements that do the actual job.

Member Function Documentation

const char* Netlink::class_name (  )  const [inline]

the class name - required by Click

Returns:
void Netlink::cleanup ( CleanupStage  stage  ) 

Cleanups everything.

If the stage is before CLEANUP_INITIALIZED, then it does nothing, else it releases the socket in both user and kernel space.

Parameters:
stage 
int Netlink::configure_phase (  )  const [inline]

This Element must be configured before the FromNetlink and ToNetlink

Returns:
the correct number so that it is configured before
int Netlink::initialize ( ErrorHandler *  errh  ) 

This method is called by Click when the Element is about to be initialized.

In user space the socket is opened here. It binds to the port 9999 which should be the one used by all applications. The netlink protocol is NETLINK_GENERIC In kernel space the kernel socket is initialized in the FromNetlink Element so that the callback defined there is passed as an argument.

Parameters:
errh 
Returns:
const char* Netlink::port_count (  )  const [inline]

the port count - required by Click - there are no input or output ports.

Returns:
const char* Netlink::processing (  )  const [inline]

an AGNOSTIC Element - actually it does not process at all - is there a better value?

Returns:
AGNOSTIC

Member Data Documentation

int Netlink::fd

the netlink socket descriptor

std::queue<WritablePacket *> Netlink::out_buf_queue

a queue (from STL to use only in user space) that holds the packets to be sent to an application via the netlink socket.
